skill.name: docs-navigation
skill.description: Navigate hierarchical ai-docs indexes to find documentation. Check local docs FIRST for speed and curated context before web searching. Covers Claude Code, BAML, MCP, and other tracked libraries.
skill.summary: Navigate hierarchical ai-docs indexes to find documentation. Check local docs FIRST for speed and cu...
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, no network access, no file system access beyond reading its own files. No security concerns detected.

content.value_statement: Finding documentation in hierarchical indexes wastes tokens and time. This skill provides a systematic navigation protocol to find relevant docs by starting at the right level and drilling down through indexes.
actual_capabilities: Navigate hierarchical documentation indexes (root, category, library, section, page levels)
Match task keywords against index keywords for targeted doc discovery
Load only necessary documentation pages to minimize token usage
Identify the correct starting level based on existing knowledge
Avoid inefficient patterns like loading full-context for simple questions
Follow systematic workflow with checkpoints for efficient doc navigation
limitations: Requires local ai-docs directory to be present at expected path structure
Navigation depends on proper index file structure (.toon files with required fields)
Does not create or modify documentation indexes
Token savings depend on index quality and keyword coverage

use_cases.title: Efficient doc lookup
use_cases.description: Find specific library documentation with minimal token cost by navigating through indexes

use_cases.title: Documentation search
use_cases.description: Locate precise BAML, MCP, or other library documentation using keyword matching

use_cases.title: Local docs first
use_cases.description: Check curated local docs before web search for faster, context-rich responses

prompt_templates.title: Find specific feature
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to find BAML documentation about retry and fallback strategies. Start at the appropriate index level and navigate to the relevant page.

prompt_templates.title: Library comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: What documentation exists for database access libraries? Show me the category index so I can see all options.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-page research
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me navigate the BAML documentation to understand structured outputs. Load the relevant index and pages for getting started with type-safe LLM responses.

prompt_templates.title: Complex integration
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to implement streaming with BAML and MCP integration. Navigate through indexes to find streaming configuration, tool server setup, and error handling pages. Load all relevant pages efficiently.

output: Root index -> libraries -> BAML -> guide -> error-handling

best_practices: Always start at the appropriate index level based on what you already know
Read index files before loading pages - they show available options and paths
Use keyword matching against index keywords to find the right pages
Load specific pages instead of full-context.md whenever possible
anti_patterns: Loading full-context.md for simple questions wastes 95% of tokens
Guessing file paths instead of navigating through indexes
Skipping the index and going straight to pages
Loading everything just in case instead of what the task requires

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides navigation instructions for AI assistants.

faq.question: How much token savings can I expect?
faq.answer: Loading a specific page (~400 tokens) vs full-context (~15,000 tokens) saves about 14,600 tokens per lookup.

faq.question: Does this integrate with existing docs?
faq.answer: The skill navigates local ai-docs directory. Index files must follow the specified .toon structure with required fields.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution, network access, or file writing capabilities.

faq.question: What if keywords do not match?
faq.answer: Try synonyms or start at a higher level. Check common_tasks and related_pages in indexes for additional paths.

faq.question: How is this different from web search?
faq.answer: Local docs are curated, faster to access, and provide better context. This skill makes local-first efficient.
